title: IHC Participation at World Economic Forum 2025 in Davos
description: IHC actively participated in the 2025 World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, with a delegation including leaders from six subsidiaries. The company focused on driving transformational solutions, fostering global partnerships, and advancing sustainable and innovative investments through its 'IHC House @ Davos' hub. Key activities included high-level engagements, panel sessions, and collaboration with global stakeholders across industries, emphasizing sustainable growth and value creation.
source_name: IHC at Davos: Driving Transformative Solutions and Global Partnerships at the World Economic Forum 2025

opportunities.title: Healthcare Technology Startups Collaborate on AI-driven Sustainability Solutions
opportunities.description: Healthcare technology startups can partner with IHC to co-develop and deploy AI-powered solutions that improve hospital sustainability, such as energy-efficient patient monitoring or waste reduction tools. IHC's focus on innovation and sustainability at Davos makes it open to collaborations that achieve shared ESG goals.
roadmap_steps: Identify IHC subsidiaries with interest in healthcare technology
Develop a concept note outlining the AI solution's benefits towards sustainability
Network with IHC representatives through event follow-up channels
Arrange a demonstration or pilot project meeting
Negotiate partnership terms

opportunities.title: Green Energy Equipment Providers Pitch to Support IHC’s Renewable Investments
opportunities.description: Manufacturers of innovative solar panels, battery storage, or water-saving tech can offer their products and expertise to support IHC’s renewable energy projects, introduced as part of its Davos sustainability messaging, aligning technological offerings with IHC’s investment strategy.
roadmap_steps: Review IHC’s recent renewable project announcements
Prepare tailored solutions showing quantifiable ESG impact
Reach out via IHC’s investment relations contact or Davos connections
Propose pilot projects or technology assessments
Negotiate supply or partnership agreements

opportunities.title: Data Analytics Firms Offer Measurement Tools for ESG Impact Evaluation
opportunities.description: Data analytics companies can collaborate by supplying platforms that track, measure, and report on ESG targets for IHC’s investments and operations, enhancing transparency around sustainability outcomes as mandated by global stakeholders and accentuated during WEF engagements.
roadmap_steps: Develop ESG analytics use-case adapted to IHC’s footprint
Request a meeting via IHC’s public ESG and sustainability teams
Demonstrate proven results with other large diversified investors
Customize solutions in response to IHC feedback
Formalize implementation partnership

opportunities.title: Food Tech Solutions for Sustainable Supply Chain Partnerships
opportunities.description: Innovators in food traceability, carbon-neutral packaging, or supply chain optimization can propose pilot programs with IHC’s food subsidiaries, supporting both groups’ commitment to sustainable growth voiced at the forum.
roadmap_steps: Identify key food industry ESG challenges in IHC’s portfolio
Design a solution pilot addressing traceability or waste reduction
Network at industry events or through post-Davos activities
Submit a proposal for a trial partnership
Set KPIs and launch pilot

opportunities.title: Space Tech Firms Offer Dual-use Innovations for Investment Expansion
opportunities.description: Companies with expertise in satellite imaging, remote sensing, or space-derived data for ESG monitoring could propose partnerships with IHC to expand dual-use tech investments, aligning with IHC’s interest in space as a new field for sustainable value creation.
roadmap_steps: Prepare a business case for space tech application in ESG or sustainability
Identify relevant IHC subsidiaries or newly formed space-focused entities
Establish contact through Davos or IHC innovation programs
Arrange a demo or exploratory workshop
Negotiate Pilot or R&D partnership terms

title: IHC Showcase of Dynamic Value Networks Concept
description: At WEF 2025, IHC highlighted its Dynamic Value Networks strategy, connecting assets across sectors to maximize synergies, prioritize stakeholder benefits, and foster sustainable partnerships. This approach spans diverse industries including healthcare, technology, space exploration, and food security, aiming to create value benefiting communities and driving global progress.
source_name: IHC at Davos: Driving Transformative Solutions and Global Partnerships at the World Economic Forum 2025

opportunities.title: Integration of Digital Health Platforms with Dynamic Value Networks
opportunities.description: Companies developing digital health solutions (such as telemedicine platforms, remote monitoring, or AI diagnostics) can partner with IHC to integrate their services into the Dynamic Value Networks, enhancing healthcare delivery, access, and community health outcomes. This partnership is realistic as it aligns with both parties' interests in maximizing value and synergy in healthcare.
roadmap_steps: Research IHC's specific needs and existing healthcare network partners
Develop integration proposal highlighting technology value for stakeholders
Make contact with IHC's partnership division
Pilot digital health service integration in select locations
Collect and present impact data to expand collaboration

opportunities.title: Collaboration for Smart Food Supply Chain Solutions
opportunities.description: Technology firms specializing in IoT-based supply chain monitoring, blockchain traceability, or AI-driven agriculture can work with IHC to enhance the food security aspect of their value networks. Such collaboration would streamline logistics, reduce waste, and assure food quality, which are direct, actionable improvements.
roadmap_steps: Identify specific supply chain pain points in IHC's food network
Propose IoT or blockchain solutions for traceability and efficiency
Initiate discussions with IHC's innovation or food division
Co-develop proof-of-concept pilot in a contained market
Scale technology upon successful pilot results

opportunities.title: Joint Ventures for ESG-Compliant Investment Products
opportunities.description: Investment firms with expertise in ESG funds can partner with IHC to co-create investment vehicles that accelerate sustainability and stakeholder-centric initiatives within IHC’s Dynamic Value Networks. This is feasible given IHC's ESG focus and the global demand for sustainable investments.
roadmap_steps: Analyze IHC’s current ESG criteria and reporting requirements
Design ESG investment products tailored to IHC’s strategy
Reach out to IHC's investment or finance leadership
Negotiate joint-venture structure and responsibilities
Launch pilot investment fund and report on outcomes

opportunities.title: Co-development of Space Data Applications for Earth-based Sectors
opportunities.description: Aerospace and data analytics firms can partner with IHC to use space observation and satellite data in addressing Earth-based industry needs (e.g., agriculture, disaster response, telecommunication), fitting into IHC’s cross-sectoral value creation model.
roadmap_steps: Identify key sectors within IHC’s network that could benefit from space data
Develop proposals demonstrating use-cases and ROI
Engage with IHC’s innovation and technology teams
Set up a pilot project to showcase value
Evaluate results and scale partnerships based on impact

opportunities.title: Deployment of Cross-sectoral Digital Platforms
opportunities.description: Technology companies can collaborate with IHC to build interoperable digital platforms facilitating data-sharing and ecosystem management across healthcare, food, and technology sectors. This materializes IHC's network ambitions and supports digital transformation.
roadmap_steps: Map IHC’s sectoral needs and interoperability challenges
Prototype platform linking multiple value chains
Contact IHC’s CTO office or digital partnerships lead
Run a cross-sector pilot with measurable KPIs
Iterate and expand platform functionality and reach

title: IHC-led Sessions and Discussions at WEF 2025
description: IHC organized and participated in multiple sessions at the World Economic Forum 2025, including a fireside chat with Robert F. Smith, a panel on future space technology led by Marlan Space, a cancer care innovation event hosted by Burjeel Holdings, and the COP30 Power Our Planet dinner hosted by the European Commission President and IHC. These events aimed to foster collaboration on innovation, sustainability, and global challenges.
source_name: IHC at Davos: Driving Transformative Solutions and Global Partnerships at the World Economic Forum 2025

opportunities.title: Advanced Space Data Analytics Partnerships
opportunities.description: Companies specializing in big data and AI analytics can partner with space technology leaders to provide data processing and AI-driven insights for satellite data, Earth observation, and in-orbit activities, leveraging discussion topics from panels on future space technology.
roadmap_steps: Survey recent advancements and needs in space data analytics
Identify satellite operators or space companies from event participants
Reach out to propose partnerships for AI-driven analytics solutions
Design pilot projects to demonstrate technology on relevant space datasets

opportunities.title: Telemedicine Integration for Cancer Care Innovation
opportunities.description: Telemedicine providers can cooperate with cancer care innovators to offer remote patient monitoring, AI-powered diagnostics, and digital health platforms, directly supporting ongoing cancer care innovation efforts highlighted during specialized events.
roadmap_steps: Contact cancer innovation event organizers or related stakeholders
Showcase telemedicine solutions tailored to oncology needs
Develop a pilot project for remote cancer patient support
Work jointly on grant applications or funding opportunities

opportunities.title: Green Technology Providers for Sustainable Energy Events
opportunities.description: Producers of renewable energy solutions (such as advanced solar panels, battery storage, or grid optimization software) can partner with energy investors and sustainability leaders to pilot and deploy green technologies under initiatives discussed at renewable energy and sustainability events.
roadmap_steps: Identify event contacts involved in Power Our Planet and COP30 discussions
Present innovative renewable energy products or services
Discuss pilot implementation opportunities with investment and sustainability partners
Build case studies to demonstrate impact and scalability

opportunities.title: Impact Investment Intelligence Collaboration
opportunities.description: Companies with expertise in ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance) data, ratings, or reporting platforms can collaborate with investment firms to provide technology for monitoring sustainability impact and regulatory compliance, expanding upon IHC-led ESG partnership conversations.
roadmap_steps: Identify investment firms active at WEF or in IHC networks
Propose ESG intelligence and reporting solutions
Arrange meetings with compliance and ESG officers
Develop tailored integrations or tools for portfolio management

opportunities.title: Space Manufacturing Collaboration for Next-Gen Satellites
opportunities.description: Companies with expertise in advanced manufacturing, robotics, or nanomaterials can partner with space exploration firms to co-develop lightweight, durable satellite components, leveraging interest from future space technology discussions.
roadmap_steps: Map advanced component or material companies to space sector needs
Engage with space technology session leaders for technical alignment
Jointly scope out co-development or prototyping projects
Secure initial funding and proof-of-concept demonstrations

opportunities.title: Healthcare AI Startups Partnering for Early Diagnosis Solutions
opportunities.description: AI startups working on early cancer detection can collaborate with healthcare providers and innovators featured in cancer care sessions to integrate new diagnostic algorithms into clinical workflows.
roadmap_steps: Contact cancer care innovation stakeholders
Share data on AI-powered diagnostic tool performance
Negotiate pilot integration in existing healthcare systems
Collect clinical feedback for regulatory and commercial rollout

title: Multiply Group Explores Acquisition Opportunities at WEF 2025
description: During WEF 2025, Samia Bouazza, CEO of Multiply Group, expressed intent to pursue acquisition opportunities to expand their global portfolio, particularly leveraging interest from consumer discretionary sector companies attracted to the UAE growth story and mega trends shaping the future economy.
source_name: IHC at Davos: Driving Transformative Solutions and Global Partnerships at the World Economic Forum 2025

opportunities.title: Consumer Retail Brands Pitching for Acquisition
opportunities.description: Consumer-focused retail brands from sectors such as beauty, fashion, electronics, or health could approach Multiply Group with tailored acquisition or partnership proposals. With Multiply’s interest in expanding its investment portfolio in the consumer discretionary sector, such brands can offer themselves as strong acquisition or strategic partnership candidates, particularly if they demonstrate strong UAE performance and alignment with emerging mega trends discussed at WEF.
roadmap_steps: Assess company strengths and alignment with mega trends relevant to the UAE market
Prepare a comprehensive pitch deck highlighting growth in the UAE and GCC region
Contact Multiply Group’s M&A team via professional channels or networking events
Negotiate terms of acquisition or joint venture opportunities
Complete required due diligence and legal documentation

opportunities.title: Financial Advisors and M&A Consultants Offering Deal Sourcing
opportunities.description: Boutique financial advisors or M&A consultancies could partner with Multiply Group to identify, vet, and propose promising acquisition targets in the consumer discretionary sector. This is realistic as Multiply Group is actively seeking acquisition avenues and would benefit from specialist deal-sourcing and evaluation expertise.
roadmap_steps: Research Multiply Group’s acquisition strategy and sector interests
Develop a targeted deal sourcing proposal showcasing track record in consumer sector M&A
Reach out to Multiply Group’s business development or corporate strategy teams
Formalize a consulting or sourcing agreement outlining terms
Present curated acquisition candidates regularly

opportunities.title: Investment Technology Platforms Facilitating Cross-Border M&A Deals
opportunities.description: Investment technology platforms specializing in cross-border M&A could offer their deal management solutions to Multiply Group to support, track, and optimize their acquisition process as they expand internationally, particularly in high-growth sectors like consumer discretionary.
roadmap_steps: Identify the challenges Multiply Group faces in cross-border acquisition management
Customize technology demo to address Multiply Group’s requirements
Initiate contact via industry events or direct outreach
Negotiate pilot program terms
Onboard Multiply Group’s team and integrate the platform with their M&A workflow

opportunities.title: Consumer Trend Analytics Firms Partnering to Drive Investment Insights
opportunities.description: Market research and consumer analytics firms can pitch their services to Multiply Group to support due diligence on investment opportunities, providing data on consumer behavior and mega trends in the UAE and globally. As Multiply Group is focused on mega trends and growth sectors, access to actionable insights is essential and makes sense for deal success.
roadmap_steps: Compile a report showing how analytics supported recent M&A activities for similar investors
Reach out with a tailored offering explaining value for Multiply Group’s acquisition strategy
Set up a meeting with Multiply’s investment analysis team
Pilot trend analytics on a small portfolio segment as proof-of-concept
Expand cooperation upon successful pilot results
